description.en: Theory and practice of literary research. Overview of literary styles and genres.
description.et: Kirjandusteaduse teooria ja kirjanduslike tekstide analüüs inglise keeles. Ülevaade kirjanduslikest stiilidest ja žanridest.

objectives.en: teaching basic theory  of  analysing literature.

independent_work.et: The detailed description of the volume of independent work is available with the Moodle learning environment of the course (https://moodle.ut.ee)). Peer assessment/feedback posted in Moddle forums  is a constituent part (pre-requisite to course completion) of students' independent work.

description.et:
Final written assessment 
A-	Exam questions are answered with maximum precision and reference to corresponding theoretical sources and are supported by references to the sample text; the answer demonstrates a very high level of independent and creative thinking and contributes to well-known interpretations of the text.
B-	Exam  questions are answered correctly and demonstrate very good knowledge of theoretical aspects and reference to the sample text; the answers reveal the ability of critical thinking and creativity at a very good level; it shows the knowledge of literary critics' opinions of the text. 
C-	Exam  questions are answered with various degrees of  precision and demonstrate good knowledge of theoretical aspects and are supported by references to the sample text; the answers  reveal partial readiness of the student to analyse a piece of literature critically; the analysis shows good level of independent thinking.
D-	Answers to exam  questions show the student's  satisfactory knowledge of some theoretical aspects  and do not have any support by example from the sample text; there are some references to other critics' opinions; the answers demonstrate satisfactory level of  independent thinking and creativity;
E-	Exam answers demonstrate student's knowledge of some basic principles of literary analysis and his/her  ability to apply them while analysisng a piece of literature in a conventional way;  the analysis demonstrates a poor  level of  independent thinking and creativity.

grade_preconditions.et: Teadmisi hinnatakse jooksvalt praktiliste tööde ja iseseisvate tööde alusel.

grade_evaluation.et:
The course finishes with a written examination in Moodle
Exam questions
1.What is Literature? What makes literature pleasant, truth in literature
2.The nature of literature. Theories of literature: imitative, expressive, affective
3.Some elements of fiction: the plot, the characters, the theme, plausibility
4.Fiction . Point of view
5.Parable, allegory, symbolism
6.Setting, style, decorum, propriety, tone
7.Narrative poetry: ballads
8.Lyric poetry, diction, tone, the voice of satirist
9.Figurative language: simile, metaphor, personification, apostrophe
10.Irony and paradox, rhythm
11.Some elements of drama, tragedy, comedy, comic tragedy

debt_elimination.et: The course participant has to account for each missed test paper within two weeks as per agreement with the lecturer.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
